column4: Got a question. I just installed wine and its going good, but the problem is, I wanna create shortcuts for my programs that are exe files....Am I able to do so and if so how?
It is possible to create a shortcut that does 'wine *file*'
What I mean is. So I have a program called skype.exe for instance, I wanna create a shorcut that when I click on it, it launches it using wine
Just using skype.exe as an example, I don't have that installed
yes, create a shortcut with command: wine *location of skype.exe*
it usually means you didn't specify the correct path: if the specified file does not exist, it will look in the system32 folder
But I copy and paste the address to my exe I am looking for
use the complete path to the exe, noting case sensitivity. If you already did, I can't help you i'm afraid.
note the first shouldn't be necessary
mind you, the .exe needs to be executable
I don't see the sol.exe in there, what do I do now?
try a 'locate sol.exe' incase you're quite sure it's on your system. If you didn't already, run 'updatedb' first.
Alright I did that, heres what I got
that means it's either not on your system, or you didn't run 'sudo updatedb' after you installed the application. Did you use a windows installer?
What application are you trying to run?
